title: Projects
text:
Each project is structured as a case study: problem → diagnosis → design → implementation → impact.



Context
University-level course requiring structural redesign.
Diagnosis
Misalignment between objectives, activities, and assessment.
Limited integration of applied practice.
Design
- Competency-based structure
- Real-article “red thread” method
- Practical group-based activities
- Assessment aligned with methodological skills
Impact
- Increased student engagement
- Clearer competency acquisition
- Faculty adoption of redesigned structure




Context
Collaborative product development in an agile framework.
Focus
- Backlog structuring
- User stories
- Acceptance criteria
- Sprint planning
- QA validation
Impact
Improved clarity in requirements and structured delivery cycles.

title: Method
text:
My methodology follows a structured progression:



Stakeholder interviews

Competency mapping

Organizational constraints analysis





Learning objectives formulation

Alignment between activities and assessment

Selection of appropriate formats and tools





Agile planning when relevant

LMS configuration

Content structuring





Competency assessment

Feedback integration

Iterative refinement

Learning is not content delivery. It is system design.
